Agent_003_Dead.synopsis: Using a speak with dead spell, we are able to talk to the spirit of Amnos, a zhentarim mercenary who was killed by a pack of gnolls

Agents_AD_Retreating.synopsis: One-shot AD for Zhent shipment survivors when they hear/see players starting a fight with the gnoll pack that have them (the agents) cornered. They back away, somewhat cowardly, not wanting to get involved

Agent_002.synopsis: Non critpath: The dialogue for the second agent, he mostly tells you to speak with the first agent. Works both if the first agent dead or alive. The gnolls could be either waiting near the entrance or gone (dead / ran away)

Agents_AD_OutOfFlasks.synopsis: Zhent agents panic as they prepare to be attacked by gnolls

AD_BetweenAgents.synopsis: Non critpath: conversation between two zhent agents while they are trappedwaiting in a cave. In the first three branches, they are desperate and out of breath as they throw flasks of fire at the cave entrance to hold off a pack of gnolls. In the final flow, the gnolls are gone. The characters are more relaxed, but traumatised by the experience.

Agent_001_CrimeSevere.synopsis: Angry and surprised, a zhent agent prepares to attack as he calls out to a player stealing an item that belongs to him.

Agent_001_Crime.synopsis: Chest-related crime-reactions for the first agent.

Agent_002_Dead.synopsis: Using a speak with dead spell, we are able to talk to the spirit of Oll, a young Zhentarim agent
Agent_002_Dead.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. goto 40.107; 40.88; 619.7564. killcombat5. Kill Olly6. addDebugSpell Target_SpeakWithDead7. Use SWD on Olly.

VB_BloodSymbol.synopsis: The party character comments on the blood symbol near the wrecked caravan. They player might reckognize the symbol.

Agent_001_TiedUp.synopsis: In situations where Rugan survives after being beaten and tortured by the Zhentarim, players can interact with him in the chair he's tied to. He's exhausted, badly beaten, and barely capable of speaking full sentences.
Agent_001_TiedUp.how_to_trigger: - loadlevel WLD_Main;- goto 31.06, 44.73, 602.95;- kill gnolls;- talk to Rugan, take the cargo (through persuasion);- goto 273.49, 5.11, -273.83;- start combat with Zhents and use killcombat right after combat starts;- talk to Rugan

Agents_AD_Attacked.synopsis: One-shot AD when player attacks Zhent agents.

Rugan_AD_AfterCombatReaction.synopsis: One-shot AD for the Rugan just after he fought gnolls. If Olly is dead Rugan approaches his body to say alternative node.

Agent_001_Dead.synopsis: Using a speak with dead spell, we are able to talk to the spirit of Rugan.

Agent_002_Crime.synopsis: Non critpath: The dialogue for the second agent, he mostly tells you to speak with the first agent. Works both if the first agent dead or alive. The gnolls could be either waiting near the entrance or gone (dead / ran away)

Agent_001_Cave.synopsis: One of a pair of Zhentarim agents trapped in a cave by gnolls. A veteran mercenary, tough, and above all else a survivor. The rest of their crew are dead. Rugan here is the senior agent of the two, and he's grimly determined to survive this terrible situation.

Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat.synopsis: Shaken Zhent agents check on their cargo after surviving an attack. Always shaken by the attack (which is now finished), and anxious if the cargo is missing/damaged, otherwise relieved.

VB_WreckedCaravan.synopsis: The party character comments on the wrecked caravan. The player might already know about the special chest from the Den Zhent Agents

Olly_AD_AfterCombatReaction.synopsis: One-shot AD for Olly after he fought gnolls and is the only agent who survived.

Olly_AD_NoRuganTouchedChest.synopsis: Zhent agent reacts to player's interacting with the chest he was guarding. He's not interested in guarding it anymore, and is preparing to leave after losing his companions to monsters.

Agent_001.synopsis: One of a pair of Zhentarim agents trapped in a cave by gnolls. A veteran mercenary, tough, and above all else a survivor. The rest of their crew are dead. Rugan here is the senior agent of the two, and he's grimly determined to survive this terrible situation.

Agent_002_CrimeSevere.synopsis: Zhent agent angrily shouts at players stealing his cargo as he prepares to attack

Agents_AD_Joining.synopsis: One-shot AD for Rugan when Zhents join the fight with the gnolls.

Agents_AD_FlasksLow.synopsis: Trapped in a cave by monsters, Olly and Rugan are running low on fire flasks.Olly is panicking and shouting to Rugan as they attempt to hold the line; Rugan is more experienced and putting on a calmer, braver face.

automatic_ordering.reasoning: 1. The death sessions for Agent_001 and Agent_002 imply that the conversations when they are alive should precede their later death dialogues. For example, a player talks with Agent_001 before using Speak With Dead to hear his spirit, and similarly for Agent_002. 2. The two sessions that deal with agents trapped in a cave show a clear sequence: one session (Agent_001_Cave) sets up the situation of being trapped by gnolls, and then AD_BetweenAgents is the ensuing conversation between the agents while they wait. 3. Two sessions describe escalating crisis over fire flasks: Agents_AD_FlasksLow (when the agents are beginning to run low) should occur before Agents_AD_OutOfFlasks (when they have fully panicked). 4. Some sessions offer alternative branches that cannot both occur in the same playthrough. For instance, when dealing with theft/crime reactions there are a “normal” version and a “severe” version for both Agent_001 and Agent_002 (i.e. Agent_001_Crime versus Agent_001_CrimeSevere and Agent_002_Crime versus Agent_002_CrimeSevere) which are mutually exclusive. 5. Similarly, the outcome for Rugan (Agent_001) can go two ways: he either survives in a diminished condition (as in Agent_001_TiedUp) or dies (leading to Agent_001_Dead). Hence these two sessions conflict. 6. In combat-related triggers, if the player chooses to attack the agents (Agents_AD_Attacked) this is an alternative to the situation where the agents opt to retreat (Agents_AD_Retreating). 7. Lastly, there appear to be two ways to represent the trapped-agent scenario: one via Agent_001 (with specific trigger instructions) and one via Agent_001_Cave (a similar backstory but used in a different branch). Thus they are mutually exclusive. In addition, the two Olly-related chest reaction sessions (Olly_AD_AfterCombatReaction and Olly_AD_NoRuganTouchedChest) represent alternative outcomes depending on what happens with Rugan, and cannot both occur in one playthrough.

Agent_003_Dead_5.speaker: Narrator
Agent_003_Dead_5.context: NodeContext: After casting a speak with dead spell

Agent_003_Dead_2.speaker: Player
Agent_003_Dead_2.text: What were you carrying in the wagons?

Agent_003_Dead_10.speaker: Dead Caravan Agent
Agent_003_Dead_10.text: Rugan... protected it... took it... north...

Agent_003_Dead_12.speaker: Narrator
Agent_003_Dead_12.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*
Agent_003_Dead_12.context: NodeContext: Our speak with dead spell runs out of power

Agent_003_Dead_6.speaker: Narrator
Agent_003_Dead_6.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

Agents_AD_Retreating_1.speaker: Rugan
Agents_AD_Retreating_1.text: Oh, gods. They've found fresh prey.
Agents_AD_Retreating_1.context: NodeContext: muttered to himself while seeing a potential massacre unfold and backing away into the shadows - 'they' are a pack of gnolls. The 'fresh prey' is the players

Agents_AD_Retreating_3.speaker: Olly
Agents_AD_Retreating_3.text: Hear that? Someone's fighting the gnolls! We should help!
Agents_AD_Retreating_3.context: NodeContext: Upon hearing a fight break out between players and a gnoll pack - Shouting to his friend who is nearby

Agents_AD_Retreating_0.speaker: Rugan
Agents_AD_Retreating_0.text: Don't be a fool, lad. Shut your mouth, and keep your head down.
Agents_AD_Retreating_0.context: NodeContext: shushing his friend on first line to avoid getting spotted and involved in a fight

Agents_AD_Retreating_2.speaker: Rugan
Agents_AD_Retreating_2.text: Leave the heroics to them that don't value their own skin.
Agents_AD_Retreating_2.context: NodeContext: in a hushed voice, to a companion rather than to players as a fight they're avoiding unfolds nearby

Agent_002_0.speaker: Olly
Agent_002_0.text: You killed the whole pack? Bloody hells.

Agent_002_1.speaker: Olly
Agent_002_1.text: Didn't expect to see you again so soon. Keeping safe?
Agent_002_1.context: NodeContext: Through his teeth, but friendly.

Agent_002_2.speaker: Olly
Agent_002_2.text: I'll be glad when we're out of this bloody cave...

Agent_002_3.speaker: Olly
Agent_002_3.text: Never seen a gnoll up close 'til today. Hope I never do again.

Agent_002_12.speaker: Olly
Agent_002_12.text: Gods, I thought you were one of them beasts!

Agent_002_5.speaker: Olly
Agent_002_5.text: Those beasts tore through our best agents - can't believe you took them down.

Agent_002_6.speaker: Olly
Agent_002_6.text: Good to see you. Killed any more beasts out there?
Agent_002_6.context: NodeContext: Through his teeth, but friendly.

Agent_002_7.speaker: Olly
Agent_002_7.text: That bloody chest can rot for all I care. I'm not cut out for this kind of work.

Agent_002_8.speaker: Olly
Agent_002_8.text: Good to see you. Killed any more beasts out there?
Agent_002_8.context: NodeContext: Through his teeth, but friendly.

Agent_002_9.speaker: Olly
Agent_002_9.text: Hey! What are you trying to pull?

Agent_002_10.speaker: Olly
Agent_002_10.text: Shouldn't have left home. I'd rather die penniless and peaceful than be torn to bits chasing riches.

Agent_002_13.speaker: Olly
Agent_002_13.text: We can't keep those monsters out for much longer!

Agents_AD_OutOfFlasks_0.speaker: Olly
Agents_AD_OutOfFlasks_0.text: I'm out of flasks! They're coming!
Agents_AD_OutOfFlasks_0.context: NodeContext: terrified, shouting desperately during a battle - the 'flask' are like flammable grenades he was using to hold back monsters, and now he's run out they're coming for him

Agents_AD_OutOfFlasks_1.speaker: Rugan
Agents_AD_OutOfFlasks_1.text: That's the last of the flasks! Fall back!
Agents_AD_OutOfFlasks_1.context: NodeContext: Shouting desperately during a battle - the flasks are like flammable grenades. Running out means they have to flee because the fire was holding their enemies back.

AD_BetweenAgents_2.speaker: Olly
AD_BetweenAgents_2.text: We should make a run for it.

AD_BetweenAgents_7.speaker: Rugan
AD_BetweenAgents_7.text: They'd tear us apart. You saw what happened to the others.

AD_BetweenAgents_10.speaker: Olly
AD_BetweenAgents_10.text: That fire won't hold them forever.

AD_BetweenAgents_1.speaker: Rugan
AD_BetweenAgents_1.text: I know! But we don't stand a chance out there.

AD_BetweenAgents_8.speaker: Olly
AD_BetweenAgents_8.text: There must be another way out!

AD_BetweenAgents_11.speaker: Rugan
AD_BetweenAgents_11.text: There is. Hurl yourself into the chasm back there.

AD_BetweenAgents_5.speaker: Rugan
AD_BetweenAgents_5.text: Aye. It'd be quicker than having your guts torn out by them beasts.

AD_BetweenAgents_13.speaker: Rugan
AD_BetweenAgents_13.text: Well, lad. It's our lucky day after all.

AD_BetweenAgents_0.speaker: Rugan
AD_BetweenAgents_0.text: The rest of our crew's half-digested, and you're still alive. That's lucky.

AD_BetweenAgents_14.speaker: Olly
AD_BetweenAgents_14.text: Someone must have found the wagon by now.

AD_BetweenAgents_3.speaker: Rugan
AD_BetweenAgents_3.context: NodeContext: grim, doesn't really believe this

AD_BetweenAgents_15.speaker: Rugan
AD_BetweenAgents_15.text: Only if whoever found the wagon is stupid enough to fight a pack of gnolls.
AD_BetweenAgents_15.context: NodeContext: preparing to let someone down

AD_BetweenAgents_9.speaker: Rugan
AD_BetweenAgents_9.text: So, no. I think help's a long way from here.
AD_BetweenAgents_9.context: NodeContext: grim, speaking a harsh truth

Agent_001_CrimeSevere_0.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_CrimeSevere_0.context: NodeContext: furious, beginning hostilities with player who is stealing his belongings

Agent_001_CrimeSevere_1.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_CrimeSevere_1.text: By the Black Hand - I told you to leave that alone!
Agent_001_CrimeSevere_1.context: NodeContext: furious, beginning hostilities with player who is stealing his belongings

Agent_001_CrimeSevere_2.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_CrimeSevere_2.context: NodeContext: furious, beginning hostilities with player who is stealing his belongings

Agent_001_Crime_2.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_Crime_2.text: By the Black Hand - I told you to leave that alone!
Agent_001_Crime_2.context: NodeContext: furious, beginning hostilities with player who is stealing his belongings

Agent_001_Crime_3.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_Crime_3.context: NodeContext: shouting at players who are tampering with a nearby chest - his cargo

Agent_001_Crime_0.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_Crime_0.text: You've my gratitude for helping with the gnolls - but that ain't yours.

Agent_001_Crime_1.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_Crime_1.text: Those beasts are going to kill us all!

Agent_002_Dead_16.speaker: Narrator
Agent_002_Dead_16.context: NodeContext: after successfully casting a speak with dead spell

Agent_002_Dead_18.speaker: Player
Agent_002_Dead_18.text: Did anyone else survive the gnolls?

Agent_002_Dead_3.speaker: Narrator
Agent_002_Dead_3.text: *The corpse remains silent. It does not know.*

Agent_002_Dead_8.speaker: Narrator
Agent_002_Dead_8.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*
Agent_002_Dead_8.context: NodeContext: our speak with dead spell runs out of power

Agent_002_Dead_21.speaker: Narrator
Agent_002_Dead_21.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*
Agent_002_Dead_21.context: NodeContext: a speak with dead spell fails

VB_BloodSymbol_0.speaker: Player
VB_BloodSymbol_0.text: That symbol, in the blood... what does it mean?

VB_BloodSymbol_1.speaker: Player
VB_BloodSymbol_1.text: That's the symbol of the Absolute. Marked in blood.

Agent_001_TiedUp_3.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_TiedUp_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Character is tied to chair.NodeContext: badly beaten, eyes closed, barely conscious, expecting to be killed

Agent_001_TiedUp_5.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_TiedUp_5.text: ... you beautiful bastard... thought my luck had finally run out...
Agent_001_TiedUp_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: either slumping in chair (no longer tied) or falling to knees, rubbing his wrists where he was boundNodeContext: exhausted and badly beaten - we just untied him from a chair where he was being tortured. Grateful and relieved but almost passing out from the pain

Agent_001_TiedUp_4.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_TiedUp_4.context: NodeContext: exhausted and beaten, afraid - right before being killed

Agents_AD_Attacked_0.speaker: Rugan
Agents_AD_Attacked_0.text: You bloody fool! C'mere, beasties - fresh meat!
Agents_AD_Attacked_0.context: NodeContext: surprised to be attacked by the player, and then shouts to get the attention of a nearby gnoll pack

Rugan_AD_AfterCombatReaction_0.speaker: Rugan
Rugan_AD_AfterCombatReaction_0.text: Well, lad. It's our lucky day after all.

Rugan_AD_AfterCombatReaction_2.speaker: Rugan
Rugan_AD_AfterCombatReaction_2.context: InternalNodeContext: Looting the bodyNodeContext: sad but pragmatic - standing over a dead companion

Rugan_AD_AfterCombatReaction_1.speaker: Rugan
Rugan_AD_AfterCombatReaction_1.context: InternalNodeContext: pocketing the moneyNodeContext: said while pocketing the money looted from his dead friend

Agent_001_Dead_1.speaker: Narrator
Agent_001_Dead_1.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*
Agent_001_Dead_1.context: NodeContext: after casting a speak with dead spell that fails

Agent_001_Dead_16.speaker: Narrator
Agent_001_Dead_16.context: NodeContext: after casting a speak with dead spell

Agent_001_Dead_6.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_Dead_6.context: NodeContext: a corpse speaking through a spell - dispassionate, cryptic

Agent_001_Dead_13.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_Dead_13.text: ... some... killer... looked a lot like you...
Agent_001_Dead_13.context: NodeContext: a corpse speaking through a spell - dispassionate, cryptic

Agent_001_Dead_19.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_Dead_19.context: NodeContext: a corpse speaking through a spell - dispassionate, cryptic

Agent_001_Dead_23.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_Dead_23.context: NodeContext: a corpse speaking through a spell - dispassionate, cryptic

Agent_001_Dead_18.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_Dead_18.context: NodeContext: a corpse speaking through a spell - dispassionate, cryptic

Agent_001_Dead_21.speaker: Player
Agent_001_Dead_21.text: And how do I find this hideout?

Agent_001_Dead_25.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_Dead_25.context: NodeContext: a corpse speaking through a spell - dispassionate, cryptic

Agent_001_Dead_10.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_Dead_10.context: NodeContext: a corpse speaking through a spell - dispassionate, cryptic

Agent_001_Dead_11.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_Dead_11.context: NodeContext: a corpse speaking through a spell - dispassionate, cryptic

Agent_001_Dead_15.speaker: Narrator
Agent_001_Dead_15.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*
Agent_001_Dead_15.context: NodeContext: our speak with dead spell runs out of power

Agent_002_Crime_0.speaker: Olly
Agent_002_Crime_0.context: NodeContext: surprised shout as we tamper with his cargo

Agent_002_Crime_3.speaker: Olly
Agent_002_Crime_3.text: We didn't drag that all the way here to let you snatch it.

Agent_002_Crime_2.speaker: Olly
Agent_002_Crime_2.text: Leave the bloody chest, and concentrate on the monsters!

Agent_002_Crime_1.speaker: Olly
Agent_002_Crime_1.text: I told you to leave that alone!
Agent_002_Crime_1.context: NodeContext: shouting at players who are stealing his belongings

Agent_002_Crime_4.speaker: Olly
Agent_002_Crime_4.context: NodeContext: shouting at players who are stealing his belongings

Agent_001_Cave_18.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_Cave_18.text: We need to deal with those beasts now. They're hungry enough to brave the fire.

Agent_001_Cave_46.speaker: Player
Agent_001_Cave_46.text: I still need more time to prepare.

Agent_001_Cave_14.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_Cave_14.context: NodeContext: urgency, panic - heavy emphasis on 'have' - we just asked for more time

Agent_001_Cave_20.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_Cave_20.text: There's nothing in there that'll help - leave it!
Agent_001_Cave_20.context: InternalNodeContext: Quiet conversation(?) - the afraid of the gnolls and don't want to provoke them

Agent_001_Cave_52.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_Cave_52.text: If we don't deal with them gnolls, none of us are getting out of here alive.
Agent_001_Cave_52.context: CinematicNodeContext: Showing the gnolls at the entrance of the cave.NodeContext: Urgency, panic

Agent_001_Cave_13.speaker: Player
Agent_001_Cave_13.text: Your Zhentarim friends sent me to retrieve the cargo.

Agent_001_Cave_44.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_Cave_44.text: You're working for Zarys? Didn't expect that black-hearted vixen to send help. Bloody grateful, mind.
Agent_001_Cave_44.context: NodeContext: Dryly - Zarys is his boss

Agent_001_Cave_24.speaker: Player
Agent_001_Cave_24.text: I'm here for the cargo - rescuing you isn't part of the plan.

Agent_001_Cave_5.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_Cave_5.context: NodeContext: urgent, silencing a panicking companion

Agent_001_Cave_11.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_Cave_11.text: I know me and the boy are expendable. Comes with the job. But we can fight - no sense in leaving us behind.
Agent_001_Cave_11.context: NodeContext: reasoning with us, sense of urgency, but understanding this is a perilous sitaution

Agent_001_Cave_40.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_Cave_40.text: Right you are. If we get out of this, I owe you.
Agent_001_Cave_40.context: NodeContext: with a curt nod - grateful

Agent_001_Cave_31.speaker: Player
Agent_001_Cave_31.text: You'll only get in the way.

Agent_001_Cave_10.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_Cave_10.text: We can handle ourselves - they got the drop on us before, but it's time for payback.
Agent_001_Cave_10.context: NodeContext: assuring us he can help in a fight, determined

Agent_001_Cave_48.speaker: Player
Agent_001_Cave_48.text: You misunderstand. I'm not going to leave you behind - I'm going to kill you.

Agent_001_Cave_43.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_Cave_43.text: I know I'm expendable. Comes with the job. But I can fight - no sense in leaving me behind.

Agent_001_Cave_25.speaker: Player
Agent_001_Cave_25.text: You'll only get in the way.

Agent_001_Cave_45.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_Cave_45.text: I can handle myself. They got the drop on us before, but it's time for payback.

Agent_001_Cave_35.speaker: Player
Agent_001_Cave_35.text: You misunderstand. I'm not going to leave you behind - I'm going to kill you.

Agent_001_Cave_26.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_Cave_26.text: Bloody fool. I hope those monsters tear you to shreds!
Agent_001_Cave_26.context: NodeContext: fury and fear - he's provoking a pack of monstrous gnolls as he says this, or preparing to, by throwing a molotov cocktail

Agent_001_Cave_22.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_Cave_22.text: Thanks. Me and the boy will do what we can to help - we've still got some fight in us.

Agent_001_Cave_12.speaker: Player
Agent_001_Cave_12.text: There's another way out - follow me.

Agent_001_Cave_27.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_Cave_27.text: Across the chasm? You might have got in that way, but you're stuck with us now.
Agent_001_Cave_27.context: NodeContext: Confused at the suggestion that we can leave across a 'chasm'. Urgent, panicked

Agent_001_Cave_36.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_Cave_36.text: Half-devil you might be, but I don't see any wings.
Agent_001_Cave_36.context: NodeContext: mocking, but desperate rather than smug

Agent_001_Cave_28.speaker: Player
Agent_001_Cave_28.text: Hold the line while I prepare for the fight.

Agent_001_Cave_38.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_Cave_38.text: Aye, that we can do. The fire won't hold them forever though. Be quick about it.

Agent_001_Cave_53.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_Cave_53.text: When the fighting starts, we'll be right alongside you.

Agent_001_Cave_42.speaker: Player
Agent_001_Cave_42.text: There's another way out - follow me.

Agent_001_Cave_37.speaker: Player
Agent_001_Cave_37.text: All right. Hold the line while I prepare for battle.

Agent_001_Cave_3.speaker: Player
Agent_001_Cave_3.text: One of us is getting out of here richer - I don't fight for free.
Agent_001_Cave_3.context: InternalNodeContext: Could make a non-persuasion node (auto-success)

Agent_001_Cave_17.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_Cave_17.text: Fine. Money's useless to dead men.
Agent_001_Cave_17.context: NodeContext: Offering to pay for our help. Abrupt - wants to get this out of the way

Agent_001_Cave_23.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_Cave_23.text: Damn it... must have dropped my purse.
Agent_001_Cave_23.context: NodeContext: patting down his pockets, confused

Agent_001_Cave_50.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_Cave_50.text: Get us out of this, and I swear we'll make it worth your while.

Agent_001_Cave_16.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_Cave_16.text: There, you are fairly bought and paid for. Let's take them!

Agent_001_Cave_41.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_Cave_41.text: Counter-offer. You fight with us, or you die with us.
Agent_001_Cave_41.context: NodeContext: Making a quick decision - and possibly a foolish one. He's going to provoke some monstrous gnolls to attack, hoping they'll kill us

Agent_001_Cave_0.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_Cave_0.text: Come and get us, you hairy bastards!
Agent_001_Cave_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: he throws fire directly at the gnolls, provoking them into attackingNodeContext: Yelling to the gnolls outside the cave, not to the player. Throwing a molotov as he speaks, or preparing to

Agent_001_Cave_49.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_Cave_49.text: Can't say I wouldn't do the same - but if we're dying here, you're dying with us!
Agent_001_Cave_49.context: CinematicNodeContext: he throws fire directly at the gnolls, provoking them into attacking

Agent_001_Cave_34.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_Cave_34.text: If you're here to help, get to the fight quickly!
Agent_001_Cave_34.context: NodeContext: shouting to player - at least one of the player's companions is already in a fight with nearby gnolls

Agent_001_Cave_47.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_Cave_47.text: Who the hells? Get over here and help!
Agent_001_Cave_47.context: InternalNodeContext: Quiet conversation(?) - the afraid of the gnolls and don't want to provoke themNodeContext: Shocked and distracted on first phrase - he's throwing items similar to molotov cocktails to hold off a pack of gnolls, and susprised to see players coming from behind. Then shouts to us for help

Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat_0.speaker: Rugan
Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat_0.text: Where the hells is the chest? It was right here!
Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat_0.context: NodeContext: surprised and anxious - lost important cargo. Voice raised but talking to nobody in particular

Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat_1.speaker: Olly
Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat_1.text: How are you holding up, Rugan?
Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat_1.context: NodeContext: relieved after a fight, checking up on his companion

Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat_4.speaker: Rugan
Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat_4.text: I'm fine. And so's the chest, more importantly.
Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat_4.context: NodeContext: relieved, responding to a companion about his wellbeing

Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat_2.speaker: Rugan
Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat_2.text: I'll be glad to see the back of this. Brought nothing but rotten luck since we left Elturgard.
Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat_2.context: NodeContext: irritated, commenting about a chest he's transporting

Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat_3.speaker: Rugan
Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat_3.context: NodeContext: relieved as he checks on important cargo after a fight

VB_WreckedCaravan_0.speaker: Player
VB_WreckedCaravan_0.text: This must be where the gnolls attacked.

VB_WreckedCaravan_1.speaker: Player
VB_WreckedCaravan_1.text: Something tore right through these people. They didn't stand a chance.

Olly_AD_AfterCombatReaction_0.speaker: Olly
Olly_AD_AfterCombatReaction_0.text: Ah, Rugan... old bastard thought he'd live forever.
Olly_AD_AfterCombatReaction_0.context: NodeContext: wry comment on the death of a companion... sad, but pragmatic

Olly_AD_NoRuganTouchedChest_1.speaker: Olly
Olly_AD_NoRuganTouchedChest_1.text: You can take the bloody chest.
Olly_AD_NoRuganTouchedChest_1.context: NodeContext: firm, he wants nothing to do with this chest anymore

Olly_AD_NoRuganTouchedChest_0.speaker: Olly
Olly_AD_NoRuganTouchedChest_0.text: Whatever's inside is probably cursed.  Brought us nothing but bad luck.

Agent_001_4.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_4.text: That drink I promised will have to wait. We're moving out. The Elfsong's my local - look me up if you're in the city.
Agent_001_4.context: NodeContext: Through his teeth, but friendly.

Agent_001_7.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_7.text: Thank the gods that's over. Wish you'd been with us when the beasts attacked on the road.

Agent_001_36.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_36.text: I'll take the cargo back to Zarys at the hideout. Drop by and see me when you can - I owe you a drink.

Agent_001_182.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_182.text: Might have been more survivors... I don't suppose you saw any of my crew alive out there?
Agent_001_182.context: NodeContext: relief but a note of concern

Agent_001_8.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_8.text: Thanks. You always seem to show up at just the right time.
Agent_001_8.context: InternalNodeContext: Rugan's thanking the player after being freed.NodeContext: Through his teeth, but friendly.

Agent_001_65.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_65.text: Thanks again. We'll head out as soon as we've caught our breath.

Agent_001_178.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_178.text: By the gods, you're a sweet sight.

Agent_001_120.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_120.text: Are any of my crew still alive out there?

Agent_001_169.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_169.text: This whole journey's been one grim sight after another. Gnolls, goblins... drow.
Agent_001_169.context: NodeContext: sadly, with disgust and fear on the last word

Agent_001_1.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_1.text: Risen Road's more dangerous than ever. You're the first friendly face we've seen since Elturgard.

Agent_001_0.speaker: Player
Agent_001_0.text: Elturgard's a long way from here. Where are you heading?

Agent_001_44.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_44.text: We're bound for Baldur's Gate - got some cargo to deliver. But we've a stop to make along the way.

Agent_001_25.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_25.text: Waukeen's Rest. It's just up the road. I'd be enjoying a mug of ale right now if those beasts hadn't jumped us.
Agent_001_25.context: NodeContext: Wau-KEEN's Rest is a tavern. Regretful

Agent_001_153.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_153.text: Listen. You look like you know how to handle yourself.
Agent_001_153.context: NodeContext: Pause before speaking as he looks us up and down, appraising us

Agent_001_46.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_46.text: You should meet my associates. We've got our own drinking spot by the tavern - invitation only.
Agent_001_46.context: NodeContext: With a smile on 'invitation only'

Agent_001_79.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_79.text: Tell the fellow on the door 'little serpent, long shadow'. He'll take good care of you.
Agent_001_79.context: NodeContext: inviting us into his secret club

Agent_001_161.speaker: Olly
Agent_001_161.context: NodeContext: Spoken to 'Rugan' - interrupting and expressing serious concern. But hissed through his teeth rather than shouted

Agent_001_59.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_59.text: It's fine. We'd be dead if they hadn't showed up. A little hospitality won't do any harm.
Agent_001_59.context: NodeContext: Reassuring his friend who just interrupted him -'they' is the player(s).

Agent_001_156.speaker: Player
Agent_001_156.text: Waukeen's Rest has been burned to the ground.

Agent_001_13.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_13.context: NodeContext: With a sad shake of the head - just got some bad news

Agent_001_131.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_131.text: Doesn't change the plan though - we'll head over there, and check for survivors.

Agent_001_19.speaker: Player
Agent_001_19.text: What's in the chest? Your cargo?

Agent_001_139.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_139.text: Aye. The whole reason we're in this mess. Trinkets for some rich tosser in Baldur's Gate.

Agent_001_90.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_90.text: He gets his shiny baubles, we get a handful of Tarenths.
Agent_001_90.context: NodeContext: disdainful.  With a shrug - follows on from a line "he gets a shiny new bauble for his dressing room...". It's a complaint about doing dangerous work for little reward. Tarenths are a currency - first syllable as in 'ta-da', second rhymes with 'tenth'.

Agent_001_136.speaker: Narrator
Agent_001_136.text: *Tarenths are the currency of a merchant network called the Zhentarim. Led by the mysterious Pereghost of Darkhold, their dealings are far from scrupulous.*
Agent_001_136.context: NodeContext: Player internal monologue, after recognising the word 'tarenths'. Tarenths are a currency - first syllable as in 'ta-da', second rhymes with 'tenth'.

Agent_001_157.speaker: Player
Agent_001_157.text: You're Zhentarim. Your people don't deal in 'baubles'.

Agent_001_56.speaker: Player
Agent_001_56.text: A lot of people died for those baubles.

Agent_001_93.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_93.text: Rich men place more value on wine and fine clothes than on the lives of folks like me.

Agent_001_138.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_138.text: It's a pretty bit of frippery that'll sit on a mantel gathering dust. But the pay for delivering it makes the risk worthwhile.

Agent_001_154.speaker: Player
Agent_001_154.text: You're Zhent - I'd wager more than just your crew have died over these 'baubles'.

Agent_001_91.speaker: Player
Agent_001_91.text: Whatever your cargo is, I'll take it as payment.

Agent_001_113.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_113.text: Listen - I'm indebted to you. And that's why I'm giving you a chance to walk away before you get yourself killed.
Agent_001_113.context: NodeContext: intimidated, but trying to defuse a potentially violent situation

Agent_001_83.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_83.text: You made short work of the gnolls... reckon you'd make shorter work of me and the boy.
Agent_001_83.context: NodeContext: intimidated, but trying to defuse a potentially violent situation

Agent_001_18.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_18.text: But we're not merchants; we're Zhentarim agents. Steal from us, and you'll have a price on your head.
Agent_001_18.context: NodeContext: intimidated, but trying to turn the tables by revealing he's a zhentarim - a network of dangerous merchants and mercenaries

Agent_001_198.speaker: Player
Agent_001_198.text: Zhentarim agents guarding a single chest. Curious.

Agent_001_88.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_88.text: If there are valuable goods on the move, The Black Company's always involved.
Agent_001_88.context: NodeContext: with a smile, trying to impress us

Agent_001_5.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_5.text: We're the grease that keeps the wheels of commerce turning.
Agent_001_5.context: NodeContext: describing the faction he works for proudly

Agent_001_67.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_67.text: And we don't take kindly to people who meddle in our business.
Agent_001_67.context: NodeContext: a threat - but delivered as a friendly warning

Agent_001_74.speaker: Player
Agent_001_74.text: If your bosses come after the chest, I'll kill them as well.

Agent_001_188.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_188.text: Tougher bastards than you have tried. Let's just go our separate ways, and be thankful we're all in one piece.

Agent_001_85.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_85.text: If I lose that cargo, my people will do worse to me than the gnolls would've.
Agent_001_85.context: NodeContext: intimidated but trying to defuse the situation

Agent_001_54.speaker: Player
Agent_001_54.text: The Zhentarim aren't known for mercy, true.

Agent_001_146.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_146.text: You know who we are - very clever. Then you probably also know it's not smart to interfere with Zhent business.
Agent_001_146.context: NodeContext: appraising us - with a friendly warning

Agent_001_63.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_63.text: This is the point when a clever operator like you accepts my gratitude and walks away.

Agent_001_42.speaker: Player
Agent_001_42.text: Enough talking. I'll have that cargo, or I'll have your head.

Agent_001_168.speaker: Player
Agent_001_168.text: No. This is the point where I stop asking, and start cutting.

Agent_001_144.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_144.text: Fine - no need for more violence. I'll tell my associates everything was lost in the ambush.
Agent_001_144.context: NodeContext: backing down from a violent situation - intimidated

Agent_001_117.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_117.text: And no hard feelings, y'hear? I'd have done the same if I were you. Business at the end of a blade is still business.

Agent_001_167.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_167.text: Ruthless bastard like you could make a name for yourself in the Zhentarim. Make sure to drop by our hideout.

Agent_001_164.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_164.text: My associates will do worse to me than you ever could.
Agent_001_164.context: NodeContext: intimidated but more scared of his associates than of us

Agent_001_177.speaker: Player
Agent_001_177.text: This is your employer's mess - but we can profit. Let's sell the cargo ourselves.

Agent_001_101.speaker: Player
Agent_001_101.text: You're missing a golden opportunity. Report the cargo lost - and we can sell it ourselves.

Agent_001_10.speaker: Player
Agent_001_10.text: You serve your oath to the Zhent impressively, but I'm afraid I'll be taking that cargo. Now.

Agent_001_127.speaker: Player
Agent_001_127.text: You'll find I'm very persuasive. We can make much more coin than you would with your employers.

Agent_001_37.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_37.text: I like the way you think. Didn't expect to turn this horrorshow to my advantage... but why not?

Agent_001_203.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_203.text: The chest's all yours. Damn thing's sealed tighter than a Duke's pursestrings, so there's no point in trying to open it.

Agent_001_61.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_61.text: I know a fence in Baldur's Gate who'll take it off your hands. Nobody will be the wiser.

Agent_001_193.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_193.text: Don't try to cut me out of the deal though. The Black Network has eyes and blades everywhere.

Agent_001_208.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_208.text: Crafty swine like you could make a name for yourself in the Zhentarim. Make sure to drop by our hideout.

Agent_001_143.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_143.text: Crafty swine like you could make a name for yourself in the Zhentarim. Make sure to drop by our hideout.

Agent_001_47.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_47.text: Pass phrase at the door is 'little serpent, long shadow'. I'll tell my associates to expect you.
Agent_001_47.context: NodeContext: with a smile, inviting us to his secret 'club'

Agent_001_3.speaker: Player
Agent_001_3.text: I already met your friends - we didn't get along too well.

Agent_001_28.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_28.text: And yet here you are. There's not many cause trouble in a Zhent hideout and walk away.

Agent_001_207.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_207.text: I'd rather walk away too. So let's say our goodbyes, and speak no more of it.

Agent_001_174.speaker: Player
Agent_001_174.text: Fair. But I expect to be paid for saving your life.

Agent_001_192.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_192.text: Of course. I was just about to suggest the same thing.

Agent_001_17.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_17.text: I'd have given you my coin already if I had any. I've nothing for you, friend.

Agent_001_64.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_64.text: I don't think so - you sound rattled. Those gnolls put up quite a fight, I bet.
Agent_001_64.context: NodeContext: assessing the situation, thinks he might have the upper hand on us

Agent_001_72.speaker: Player
Agent_001_72.text: You can leave - but your cargo stays.

Agent_001_204.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_204.text: Take it. Just let me go - you don't need any more blood on your hands.

Agent_001_123.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_123.text: You talk big - but I don't believe you took on the whole hideout. This belongs to the Zhent!
Agent_001_123.context: NodeContext: 'This' is his cargo, a nearby chest. Assessing us and thinking he can take us on

Agent_001_159.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_159.text: Coin ain't any use to the dead. And dead's what I'll be if I welch on this deal.
Agent_001_159.context: NodeContext: intimidated but trying to talk himself out of a violent situation

Agent_001_196.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_196.text: Let's go our separate ways, and be thankful we're all in one piece.
Agent_001_196.context: NodeContext: trying to calm a potentially violent situation

Agent_001_162.speaker: Player
Agent_001_162.text: You had your chance. Either way, that cargo's mine.

Agent_001_49.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_49.text: Bloody fool. May the Black Hand take you.

Agent_001_126.speaker: Player
Agent_001_126.text: The cargo. Give it to me. Or else.

Agent_001_121.speaker: Player
Agent_001_121.text: Darkhold was getting concerned. I've been sent to retrieve the shipment.
Agent_001_121.context: InternalNodeContext: needs to set a zhentarim pereghost deception flag stage 1 global flag

Agent_001_45.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_45.text: Zarys won't be happy. But, I suppose she can take it up with the Pereghost herself. Take the chest.

Agent_001_140.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_140.text: If you haven't stopped by our Waukeen's Rest spot, you should. I'm sure Zarys'd welcome such a... prestigious guest.

Agent_001_133.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_133.text: Invoking the Pereghost is a bold lie indeed. A smart lie, too.

Agent_001_206.speaker: Narrator
Agent_001_206.text: *Tarenths are the currency of the Zhentarim - a network of merchants and mercenaries with few scruples.*
Agent_001_206.context: NodeContext: Player internal monologue, after recognising the word 'tarenths'. Tarenths are a currency - first syllable as in 'ta-da', second rhymes with 'tenth'.

Agent_001_158.speaker: Player
Agent_001_158.text: It's not hospitality I want - it's coin.

Agent_001_200.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_200.text: Shame we lost so many agents. But the chest is all that matters - Zarys'd have our hides if we lost it.
Agent_001_200.context: NodeContext: interior monologue as we read his thoughts - reflective and pragmatic

Agent_001_86.speaker: Player
Agent_001_86.text: Not looking for new friends. Looking for coin. Now.

Agent_001_190.speaker: Player
Agent_001_190.text: Zarys sent me to secure the cargo.

Agent_001_52.speaker: Player
Agent_001_52.text: Zarys sent me to secure the cargo.

Agent_001_66.speaker: Player
Agent_001_66.text: Maybe I should come - see you don't get waylaid again.

Agent_001_122.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_122.text: Thanks. But that won't be necessary. We'll find help at Waukeen's Rest.
Agent_001_122.context: NodeContext: Turning down an offer of an escort from players. Wau-KEEN's rest is a nearby inn

Agent_001_141.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_141.text: Trinkets for some rich tosser in Baldur's Gate.

Agent_001_186.speaker: Player
Agent_001_186.text: I'll stay friendly - so long as you hand over all your goods.

Agent_001_12.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_12.text: Hold on now. You made short work of the beasts, and I reckon you'd make shorter of me and the boy.
Agent_001_12.context: NodeContext: intimidated, trying to defuse a hostile situation

Agent_001_135.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_135.text: But we're not plump little merchants you can boss around.
Agent_001_135.context: NodeContext: with a note of warning

Agent_001_100.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_100.context: CinematicNodeContext: He shows us a Zhent symbol - held in his hand - a medallion maybe?NodeContext: expecting us to be intimidated/impressed - the Zhentarim are a dangeorus faction of gangster-like mercenaries and merchants

Agent_001_181.speaker: Player
Agent_001_181.text: All I saw was blood and guts.

Agent_001_187.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_187.text: Damn it. I guess that's a no.
Agent_001_187.context: NodeContext: with a sad shake of the head - accepting that all his companions are probably dead

Agent_001_26.speaker: Player
Agent_001_26.text: All dead. Zarys sent me to secure the cargo.

Agent_001_77.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_77.text: We'll take the chest back to the hideout. I owe you a drink. Lots of drinks.

Agent_001_38.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_38.text: Since when does a mule know what it carries?
Agent_001_38.context: NodeContext: comparing himself to 'a mule' with a wry smile

Agent_001_34.speaker: Player
Agent_001_34.text: This isn't a rescue, it's a robbery. I want the chest.

Agent_001_199.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_199.text: You bloody idiot. If Zarys doesn't get that chest, she'll have us all killed.
Agent_001_199.context: NodeContext: intimidated but trying to talk himself out of a threatening situation

Agent_001_170.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_170.text: You saved my life. I'm grateful for that - Zarys will be too - but I need to deliver the cargo. This is the point when you walk away.
Agent_001_170.context: NodeContext: intimidated but trying to talk himself out of a threatening situation

Agent_001_173.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_173.text: Bloody fool. You don't scare me!
Agent_001_173.context: NodeContext: intimidated despite the bravado- preparing to defend himself

Agent_001_155.speaker: Player
Agent_001_155.text: The chest is mine now. Only question is if you live or not.

Agent_001_149.speaker: Player
Agent_001_149.text: You owe me more than a drink. How about some coin?

Agent_001_73.speaker: Player
Agent_001_73.text: I'll buy my own drinks. Money. Now.

Agent_001_137.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_137.text: Black Hand be thanked. I didn't think anyone would find us.

Agent_001_179.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_179.text: Risen Road's more dangerous than ever. Packs of gnolls running wild. Be careful out there.
Agent_001_179.context: NodeContext: Through his teeth, but friendly.

Agent_001_185.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_185.text: The chest's yours. I've got nothing else for you, and I don't want trouble.

Agent_001_202.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_202.text: Remember - getting that chest to Baldur's Gate is your job. Then we share the profits.

Agent_001_209.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_209.text: Thanks again. Hope Zarys treated you to something nice.
Agent_001_209.context: NodeContext: Through his teeth, but friendly.

Agent_002_CrimeSevere_0.speaker: Olly
Agent_002_CrimeSevere_0.context: NodeContext: furious, beginning hostilities with player who is stealing his belongings

Agent_002_CrimeSevere_1.speaker: Olly
Agent_002_CrimeSevere_1.context: NodeContext: furious, beginning hostilities with player who is stealing his belongings

Agent_002_CrimeSevere_2.speaker: Olly
Agent_002_CrimeSevere_2.text: You bloody fool - I told you to leave that alone!
Agent_002_CrimeSevere_2.context: NodeContext: furious, beginning hostilities with player who is stealing his belongings

Agents_AD_Joining_0.speaker: Rugan
Agents_AD_Joining_0.text: Take the leader down - I'll try to hold the rest back!
Agents_AD_Joining_0.context: NodeContext: Shouting orders as a fight against a gnoll pack starts

Agents_AD_Joining_1.speaker: Rugan
Agents_AD_Joining_1.text: Take the leader down - we'll try to hold the rest back!
Agents_AD_Joining_1.context: NodeContext: Shouting orders as a fight against a gnoll pack starts

Agents_AD_FlasksLow_1.speaker: Olly
Agents_AD_FlasksLow_1.context: NodeContext: panicked, shouting to a companion across a small cave as they attempt to hold off an attack

Agents_AD_FlasksLow_3.speaker: Rugan
Agents_AD_FlasksLow_3.text: Keep steady. We're not finished yet.
Agents_AD_FlasksLow_3.context: NodeContext: raised voice, trying to impose calm on a panicked situation

Agents_AD_FlasksLow_0.speaker: Olly
Agents_AD_FlasksLow_0.text: The fire's the only thing holding them back!
Agents_AD_FlasksLow_0.context: NodeContext: panicked, shouting to a companion across a small cave as they attempt to hold off an attack

Agents_AD_FlasksLow_2.speaker: Rugan
Agents_AD_FlasksLow_2.text: I've been in worse spots, lad. Just follow my lead.
Agents_AD_FlasksLow_2.context: NodeContext: raised voice, trying to impose calm on a panicked situation
